docs.snippet: AMARILLO, Tex., April 22 Miss Gwendolyn Bush O'Brien, daughter of. Frank T. O'Brien and the late Mrs. O'Brien, was married this afternoon to Stanley Marsh 3d, son of Mrs. Marsh Jr. and the late Mr. Marsh. The Roman Catholic ceremony was performed in...
docs.lead_paragraph: AMARILLO, Tex., April 22 Miss Gwendolyn Bush O'Brien, daughter of. Frank T. O'Brien and the late Mrs. O'Brien, was married this afternoon to Stanley Marsh 3d, son of Mrs. Marsh Jr. and the late Mr. Marsh. The Roman Catholic ceremony was performed in the bride's home at the Frying Pan Ranch by the Rev. Michael Heneghan. The Rev. Joseph Sheeler, a Presbyterian minister, gave the blessing.

headline.main: Father Is Escort Of Miss O'Brien At Her Marriage; Texas Law Graduate Is Wed to Stanley Marsh 3d, Rancher-Banker

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 26--Raul Prebisch, Secretary General of the United Nations Trade and Development Conference,. said today that there were "very positive" indications of a new United States policy on trade preferences for developing countries.
docs.abstract: R Prebisch sees US liberalizing trade preferences for poor countries

docs.snippet: MIAMI BEACH--Discussions of procedures for enacting new tourist legisla tion, and amending existing laws to-adjust them to the travel industry's needs, will highlight the 10th annual convention of the Confederation of Latln-American Tourist...
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH--Discussions of procedures for enacting new tourist legisla tion, and amending existing laws to-adjust them to the travel industry's needs, will highlight the 10th annual convention of the Confederation of Latln-American Tourist Organizations (COTAL). The meeting will be held here from May 21 to 26.
docs.abstract: Confed of Latin-Amer Tourist Orgns conv, set for Miami Beach, to study problems of increasing inter-Amer tourism; govt efforts to attract tourists noted

headline.main: Tourism Parley in Miami; Inter-American Talks Aim to Spur Travel In Hemisphere
